meanings.definition: A person who subdues or conquers.
meanings.sent1: The brave subduer defeated the enemy in battle.
meanings.sent2: The subduer led his army to victory against all odds.
meanings.sent3: The legendary subduer always had a plan to outsmart his foes.
meanings.sent4: She was a subduer of fears, facing challenges with unwavering courage.
meanings.sent5: The young subduer's name was whispered in awe throughout the land.

meanings.definition: To bring under control or subjection.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to subduer the noisy classroom before starting the lesson.
meanings.sent2: He tried to subduer his excitement when he received the good news.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to subduer the flames quickly to prevent a kitchen disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice helped to subduer the crying child.
meanings.sent5: The police officer had to subduer the suspect without causing harm.

meanings.sent1: She tried to subduer her nerves before going on stage.
meanings.sent2: The music helped to subduer the chaos of the busy city streets.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes never failed to subduer the audience's laughter.
meanings.sent4: The gentle rain helped to subduer the raging storm.
meanings.sent5: His kind words were able to subduer her anger and frustration.
